entry.title: Make text selection work even with cancelled mousemoves.
entry.content:
This CL updates Blink text selection behavior to be agnostic to

mousemove cancellation, behind the flag MouseDragOnCancelledMouseMove.



It also adds a UseCounter to assess the real-world impact of the

change. Currently text selection updates are suppressed on a

cancelled mousemove, which is not spec-compliant. In the past we

tried to fix this discrepancy but faced compat challenges. Ideally we

would assess the risk without exposing the changed behavior but that

seems impossible in this case. So we are planning to expose the

change in a controlled manner to be able to monitor the impact through

the UseCounter.



Bug: 346473

Change-Id: Id069ebc4c6aaf1603ea9e5e06b79d4e4e1f0b0f1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5038036

entry.title: Android: Fail early for wrong ABI
entry.content:
Previously on 64-bit only devices (e.g. pixel 7) apks and bundles

containing 32-bit chrome can be installed and a RuntimeException will

occur on startup. It is easy to miss the RuntimeException and mistakenly

assume the failure is due to some other exception in the logcat.



This CL checks whether the application defines android:use32bitAbi and

prevents installation on 64-bit only devices if the value is true (or

'0xffffffff' from aapt.Dump). Link to the native libs doc for choosing

the correct 64-bit chrome target name.



Bug: 1335139

Fixed: 1335139

entry.title: arc/tracing: use TimeTicks; real commits in tests
entry.content:
Use TimeTicks rather than Time, as the former is what is given when

receiving frame present events.



Use actual commit events in the tracing test so that tests behave more

like the production code. Use a callback for getting the current

time. This is similar to timestamp handling in

ArcGraphicsTracingHandlerTest. I went with a callback rather than a

template method for the time being in case the method needs to be used

by more than one class, and to avoid an extra template method for

creating a custom Session subclass in the owning class, to be overridden

by tests in addition to the tick getter method.



Where the argument type was changed from Time to TimeTicks, pass by

value instead - see recommendation on line 25 in base/time/time.h.



Test: autotest_private_apitest.cc

Test: arc_app_performance_tracing_unittest.cc

Test: trace an app and report with UMA

Bug: b/308961933

Change-Id: I0fa9c818061f56344f0ebbf5745bc30ce243b85c

entry.title: Make license paths absolute and avoid wildcards
entry.content:
The license checker in //tools/licenses/licences.py requires paths to

be absolute from the source root or relative from the README.chromium

file's directory. The checker also does not handle wildcards, but it

accepts a comma-separated list.



So make gnrt vendor create license file paths in this format, and

change the `license_file` config option to `license_files` instead

for crates with more than one file to specify.



Verify there are no errors by building the GN target:

components/cronet:generate_license

entry.title: Add a signaling message to notify the client that it should reconnect
entry.content:
This CL adds a new signaling message which the host will send to the

client when it is configured for reconnections and a new host

instance has been spun up and is ready for a connection. The impetus

for this change is that the host will likely be recreated within a

couple of seconds of ash-chrome being torn down but the client will

wait ~15 seconds to reconnect. This shortens the reconnection time

for normal usage by ~10 seconds per incident.



An important note is that the signaling message is send to the

'previous' client signaling address. The client creates a new

registration id for each connection (and reconnection) so sending it

to the old address means it will only be received (and invoke the

reconnect action) if the client hasn't already started the

reconnection process due to the 15 second timeout.



Bug: b:309446315

Change-Id: I12cc4628fd8555a49a47a4feb0ffc9e43e0bb626

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5078390

entry.title: arc/tracing: stop inheriting from TracingSession
entry.content:
The use of inheritance here was confusing and made testability

difficult. Remove it and just use a single class called

ArcAppPerformanceTracingSession, where before we had two subclasses.



The ArcAppPerformanceTracing class already is aware of the two possible

uses of the session instances, and the polymorphic behavior was used in

only a few spots, all of which were still particular to a particular

child instance. So make the Tracing class just invoke the proper helper

methods (for UMA sessions) or just collect and return the Dict inline

(for "custom" sessions).



This will make custom implementations for tests easier since we can

either create a single test-specific subclass with custom timer logic,

or add a timer callback member to the TracingSession class. Before this

would have been difficult as there were two existing TracingSession

subclasses.



Move the JSON conversion logic out of autotest_private_api so that any

changes to the data returned (e.g. new or renamed fields) will have a

smaller blast radius, as only TracingSession will need to be updated. It

also makes handling the fail/success dichotomy simpler in

TracingSession, as std::optional can be used to indicate the result is

not yet ready, whereas using the PerfTraceResult class would require

somehow distinguishing failed from not-yet-available results.



Test: ArcAppPerformanceTracingTest

Test: autotest_private_apitest.cc

Test: trace an app and report with UMA

Test: tast run arcappgameperf.GachaClub.vm and check valid results-chart.json

entry.title: WebUI: Add third_party/lit folder with necessary BUILD.gn setup.
entry.content:
Specifically adding:

1) //third_party/lit/v3_0:build_ts

A ts_library() target, holding .d.ts definition files to be added

as a dependency from any other targets that will be using Lit.

2) A lit.ts file used as input to bundle_js() (after passed through

the target at #1)

3) //third_party/lit/v3_0:build_bundle

A bundle_js() target, along with a custom Rollup config and plugin,

used to create bundled JS file containing all Lit related

dependencies.

4) //third_party/lit/v3_0:build_grdp

A generate_grd() target, referenced by other parts of the code, in

order to include lit.rollup.js in the final build.



Also hooking up the //third_party/lit/v3_0:build_grdp target such that

Lit is served at runtime from [1] (only for debug builds for now).

entry.title: Remove base::Passed() use in ChromeDownloadManagerDelegate.
entry.content:
ShouldCompleteDownload(..., base::OnceClosure callback) is a

"potentially async" API: when it completes synchronously, it returns

true and never invokes `callback`; otherwise, it invokes `callback` when

the download should be completed.



However, if a user of `ShouldCompleteDownload()` wants to always signal

the result via a callback, this becomes tricky with a OnceCallback,

since `callback` is consumed even on synchronous completion.



`base::Passed()` was a legacy hack to support move-only types with

repeating callbacks; modern code should use `base::SplitOnceCalblack()`,

which was specifically implemented to support this style of API.



Bug: 1326449

entry.title: privacy-hub: Add Ambient Weather support for PH geolocation
entry.content:
Ambient Weather is the feature of screensaver that displays the ambient

temperature, by resolving the device geolocation. This is different from

other system geolocation clients, that use `SimpleGeolocationProvider`.

Instead, Ambient Weather directly talks to the Backdrop server to

retrieve weather information.



Add permission checking logic to its scheduling loop. Ambient Weather

should stop sending and processing of weather requests/responses, when

system permission is denied. The request loop is renewed, when

permission is granted back (if there are weather clients awaiting).



Bug: b:297024110

entry.title: [iOS] Recent tab sign-in ask which accounts to use.
entry.content:
The recent-tab sign-in promo behaves differently than the other sign-

in promos. When there is an identity on the device, most sign-in

promos have two buttons, the first one doing an instant sign-in with

the primary account, the other one allow to select the account.



Recent tab always have a single button. It is expected to behave as

the secondary button instead of the primary one, when there are

accounts on the device.



When there are no identity on the devices, all promos have a single

button, opening the add-account view.



The recent-tab view decided the behavior of the button when the view

was created, and did not take into account whether identities were

added or removed from the device; which caused the wrong behaviour

to be triggered.



This CL add an extra button semantic, which does not define a specific

action, and instead defer the action to execute to the moment when the

button is tapped.





I use low-coverage-reason because the line highlighted as not covered is NOTREACHED.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Other

Fixed: 1505294

Change-Id: Ifea979da3e724c72fd2767b5e529e9ec0e9b72b8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5071613

entry.title: Revert "Fully allocate space when there is a size mutation in the custom flex rule."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1999486097a1d24c0c05e02bf725353b774522eb.



Reason for revert: This CL is causing the tab hover card size to be incorrectly calculated which results in the tab thumbnail image to take up space when it is not supposed to and clips the hover card footer.

See crbug.com/1506422.



Original change's description:

> Fully allocate space when there is a size mutation in the custom flex rule.

>

> When space is constrained for multi-line labels, the size mutates due to

> character wrapping. In this case, the remaining space generated by the

> mutation cannot be allocated. eg: HelpBubbleView.

>

> Here we introduce the CSS flexbox allocation algorithm. But there are

> some differences in the behavior of views. So based on the css flexbox

> algorithm, some special modifications were made to adapt the current

> behavior.

>

entry.title: Remove AndroidAutofillViewStructureWithFormHierarchyLayer feature.
entry.content:
The feature was never launched. It turns out that the Android Autofill

framework in its current state does not support multiple concurrent

Autofill sessions. Similarly, it assumes that all forms contained in a

ViewStructure can be filled simultaneously. As a result, a ViewStructure

should always contain at most the information of a single FormData

object. However, if that is the case, no additional hierarchy layer is

needed and this experiment therefore obsolete.

entry.title: [Code Health] Remove uses of Notification Service
entry.content:
This change removes the last remaining use of the notification type:

NOTIFICATION_LOAD_START.



This CL also refactors the observer to allow it to be used by WebView

and Chromium. The key changes are:

* Move `MetricsServicesWebContentsObserver` into

`components/metrics/content`

* Update `MetricsServicesWebContentsObserver` to take as parameters

callbacks that correspond to the desired events

* Update `AndroidMetricsServiceClient` to use the new observer

(`MetricsServicesWebContentsObserver`) and remove

`AndroidMetricsServiceClient::WebContentsObserverImpl`



Note that `MetricsServicesWebContentsObserver` uses callbacks to remove

the dependency on the `MetricsServicesManager`, which is not present for

WebView.



An alternate failed approach, instead of using callbacks, consisted of

having the `MetricsServicesManager` create the observer and, update the

observer to take as a parameter the `MetricsServiceClient`, however this

requires introducing a dependency on `//components/metrics:content`

which is not desired, since `MetricsServicesManager` is also used on

IOS.



Bug: 1174762

entry.title: [font-size-adjust] Move `IdeographicInlineSize` to `SimpleFontData`
entry.content:
Implementing `font-size-adjust` requires vertical advance even

in horizontal flow, but computing vertical advance is rather

expensive that it should be computed only when it's necessary.



To do this, this patch moves `IdeographicInlineSize` from

`FontMetrics` to `SimpleFontData`. This allows computing it

on demand, moving the logic out from `PlatformGlyphInit`,

similar to how `TypoAscentAndDescent` is computed.



This patch also renames `IdeographicFullWidth` to

`IdeographicInlineSize`, in preparation for adding physical

versions in future.



This patch has no behavior changes.

entry.title: Enable LazyLoadScrollMargin
entry.content:
This patch enables the LazyLoadScrollMargin flag by default.



When enabled, the lazy load intersection observer's init dictionary

will use a scrollMargin instead of a rootMargin which allows lazy

loading images contained inside CSS scrollers, like carousels, to load

as expected when near the viewport instead of the current behavior

where these images load when at least one pixel is intersecting the

viewport.



Spec:

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#lazy-load-root-margin



Chrome Status:

https://chromestatus.com/feature/5106926245642240



Intent to Ship:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/cn9_443jGgI/m/Db5wnIhxAAAJ



R=pdr

entry.title: Remove base::Passed() use in cert db helper for platform keys.
entry.content:
Retrieving a NSSCertDatabase uses a potentially-async pattern of the

form:



NSSCertDatabase* GetDatabase(

base::OnceCallback callback);



When a result can be returned synchronously, `GetDatabase()` returns a

non-null pointer and never invokes `callback`; when the result is

returned asynchronously, `GetDatabase()` returns `nullptr` and invokes

`callback` when the result is ready.



However, if a user of `GetDatabase()` wants to *always* return the

result via callback, this becomes tricky with base::OnceCallback,

because the `callback` argument is consumed, even when the result is

returned synchronously.



`base::Passed()` was a legacy hack to support move-only types with

repeating callbacks; modern code should use `base::SplitOnceCalblack()`,

which was specifically implemented to support this style of API. Also

migrate the code to use `base::BindPostTask()` to trampoline the result

back to the origin task runner and delete another bespoke helper.



Bug: 1326449

Change-Id: I9af82f9fdc7873b7f14633f08d1ae4ce52e5be8c

entry.title: [Private Network Access] Update top-level navigation failed UI and disable auto-reloading
entry.content:
Currently, when PNA checks fail for a top-level navigation, it will

first show a generic error page, and then auto-reload in about a second.

The reload will be seen as initiated by the browser, so will bypass the

PNA checks. This CL adds a special net error code for

requests that fail PNA checks, so we can disable auto-reload and

show a special error page to explain to user why the page was blocked

and what would happen if they reload manually.

entry.content:
This change enables the fluent virtual test suites for Linux. This

consists of:



- Reference images for Linux, due to Linux not including the font used

for arrows on Windows.

- Adding fluent-specific expected scroll offsets to test files. The

scroll offsets can be different when fluent scrollbars are enabled

because the minimum thumb length for a fluent scrollbar is smaller

than the previous minimum thumb length for Chromium on Linux. This

means that dragging a scrollbar thumb X pixels can lead to a

different scroll offset than previously.

entry.title: [gbb-cct] Fix NPE on Boolean; remove observers.
entry.content:
1. Do a null check on the value of `mInMotionSupplier.get()`. This avoids crbug/1505307, where apparently the Boolean is null.

2. The above crash has made me extra paranoid about other edge cases we might not have thought about. So this CL also removes some observers which might potentially cause trouble, in `destroy()`.



Bug: 1505307

entry.title: [Autofill] Add and use FormDataImporterTestApi
entry.content:
This CL introduces FormDataImporterTestApi to make the non-private API

of FormDataImporter more accessible and to make it clear when tests

are testing the contract or internals of FormDataImporter.



A followup step to reduce test complexity could be to inject

AddressProfileSaveManager, CreditCardSaveManager, IbanSaveManager,

VirtualCardEnrollmentManager, rather than creating them in

in FormDataImporter(). Currently tests first create a standard

FormDataImporter and then tweak the private variables.



Bug: 1119526
